intro: Macaranga heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf makara, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes and sizes. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are often palmately lobed, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
